about.name: Shenzhen
about.info_text: Shenzhen is a dynamic and modern metropolis located in the Guangdong Province of southern China. It is known for its rapid economic growth, impressive skyscrapers, and vibrant tech scene. Shenzhen is a city of innovation, offering a blend of urban development and natural beauty, with its proximity to the South China Sea. Visitors can explore its bustling city center, visit historic sites, and enjoy a range of entertainment and cultural attractions.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 17.5 million
Province: Guangdong
Time Zone: China Standard Time (UTC+08:00)
Language: Mandarin, Cantonese
Currency: Chinese Yuan (CNY)
about.climate_text: Shenzhen has a subtropical climate with mild, pleasant winters and hot, humid summers. The city is known for its year-round warmth and occasional typhoons during the summer months.

attractions_card.title: Window of the World
attractions_card.description: Window of the World is a popular theme park that features miniature replicas of famous landmarks from around the world, making it a great place for cultural exploration and entertainment.

attractions_card.title: Shenzhen Civic Center
attractions_card.description: The Shenzhen Civic Center is a modern architectural marvel, home to the city's government offices, a concert hall, and a library, offering a hub of cultural and administrative activities.

attractions_card.title: Dameisha Beach
attractions_card.description: Dameisha Beach is a popular seaside destination in Shenzhen, featuring a long stretch of sandy shoreline, water sports, and a vibrant boardwalk.

attractions_card.title: Splendid China Folk Village
attractions_card.description: Splendid China Folk Village showcases the rich cultural diversity of China through miniature landscapes, traditional architecture, and live performances.

attractions_card.title: Lianhuashan Park
attractions_card.description: Lianhuashan Park offers serene natural surroundings, with lush gardens, a lake, and the opportunity for hiking and outdoor relaxation.

attractions_card.title: Shenzhen Museum
attractions_card.description: Shenzhen Museum is a cultural institution that provides insights into the city's history, art, and development through a variety of exhibitions.

attractions_card.title: Shenzhen Bay Park
attractions_card.description: Shenzhen Bay Park is a scenic waterfront park with walking and cycling paths, gardens, and beautiful views of the bay and the Hong Kong skyline.

attractions_card.title: Guanlan Print Village
attractions_card.description: Guanlan Print Village is an artistic hub known for its printmaking studios, galleries, and the opportunity to explore traditional Chinese art techniques.

food_card.title: Dim Sum
food_card.description: Dim Sum is a popular Cantonese cuisine featuring a variety of bite-sized dishes, including dumplings, buns, and rolls. Try local dim sum restaurants for an authentic experience.

food_card.title: Hot Pot
food_card.description: Hot Pot is a communal dining experience where you cook a variety of ingredients in a flavorful broth. It's a great way to enjoy a social meal with friends and family.

food_card.title: Seafood
food_card.description: Shenzhen's proximity to the South China Sea means you can enjoy a wide range of fresh seafood dishes, including shrimp, crab, and fish prepared in various styles.

food_card.title: Barbecue (Chuanr)
food_card.description: Chuanr refers to Chinese-style barbecue skewers, often featuring a selection of meats, vegetables, and tofu, seasoned and grilled to perfection.

food_card.title: Hakka Cuisine
food_card.description: Shenzhen is known for its Hakka cuisine, which includes dishes like stuffed tofu, salt-baked chicken, and preserved vegetables with meat.

hotels_card.title: The Ritz-Carlton, Shenzhen
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton offers luxury accommodations in the heart of Shenzhen, with elegant rooms, fine dining, and stunning city views.

hotels_card.title: Grand Hyatt Shenzhen
hotels_card.description: The Grand Hyatt Shenzhen is a high-end hotel in the Luohu district, offering stylish rooms, diverse dining options, and convenient access to shopping and attractions.

hotels_card.title: Futian Shangri-La, Shenzhen
hotels_card.description: The Futian Shangri-La is a luxurious hotel known for its comfortable accommodations, beautiful garden spaces, and gourmet restaurants.

hotels_card.title: The Langham, Shenzhen
hotels_card.description: The Langham offers a blend of modern luxury and classic elegance, featuring spacious rooms, a spa, and a range of dining options.

hotels_card.title: Shangri-La Hotel, Shenzhen
hotels_card.description: The Shangri-La Hotel in Shenzhen provides comfortable accommodations, a health club, and a variety of dining experiences for guests.

transport_card.title: Shenzhen Metro
transport_card.description: The Shenzhen Metro is a convenient way to navigate the city, with multiple lines connecting key areas, making it easy for travelers to get around.

transport_card.title: Public Buses
transport_card.description: Shenzhen's public bus system is extensive, offering a budget-friendly way to explore the city and reach various destinations.

transport_card.title: Taxis
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Shenzhen and can be hailed on the street or booked through ride-sharing apps for convenient transportation.

transport_card.title: Shenzhen Bao'an International Airport
transport_card.description: Shenzhen Bao'an International Airport (SZX) is the main airport serving the city, providing domestic and international flights for travelers.
